column1: In the  case of  The King Vs.  Aron Appuhamy (51NLR 358) and John Perera

column2: (53  NLR  158)  it  was  held  that  amendment  of a  charge  or
indictment should be allowed if it  would have the effect of convicting the guilty or
securing  the  acquittal  of the  innocent.  But  it  should  not  be  allowed  if it  would

column1: cause substantial injustice or prejudice to the accused.
